intro: Epilobium montanum f. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered willow herb, is a botanical variant of the willow herb species. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is the white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges.
